conclusion: The problem involves an ideal gas undergoing a cyclic process A→B→C→D→A with known temperature at state A.
Temperature at state A, \( T_A = 27^\circ \text{C} = 300 \text{ K} \).
Pressure at state A, \( p_A = 1 \times 10^5 \text{ Pa} \).
Volume at state A, \( V_A = 3 \text{ L} \).
Pressure at state B, \( p_B = 1 \times 10^5 \text{ Pa} \).
Volume at state B, \( V_B = 4 \text{ L} \).
The ideal gas law is given by \( pV = nRT \).

premise: Since the number of moles \( n \) and the gas constant \( R \) are constant.
Substitute the known values into the equation.
conclusion: Equation becomes \( \frac{(1 \times 10^5 \text{ Pa})(3 \text{ L})}{300 \text{ K}} = \frac{(1 \times 10^5 \text{ Pa})(4 \text{ L})}{T_B} \).
Equation simplifies to \( \frac{3 \times 10^5 \text{ Pa} \cdot \text{L}}{300 \text{ K}} = \frac{4 \times 10^5 \text{ Pa} \cdot \text{L}}{T_B} \).
